## Session Overview

This focused 1-hour session introduces SC-IM (Spreadsheet Calculator Improved), a powerful terminal-based spreadsheet application. You'll learn how to navigate, manipulate data, create formulas, and perform data analysis tasks entirely within a text-based environment. This lightweight but powerful alternative to traditional GUI spreadsheet applications offers speed, efficiency, and the ability to integrate with other command-line tools.

### Next Session

- **Date:** June 15, 2025
- **Time:** 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM
- **Format:** Available in-person or live virtual
- **Prerequisites:** Basic command line familiarity
- **Price:** $39 per participant (includes reference materials and sample spreadsheets)

## Session Curriculum

### Part 1: SC-IM Basics (15 minutes)

**Introduction to SC-IM**
- History and philosophy of terminal-based spreadsheets
- Installation and initial setup
- Interface overview and layout
- Navigation and movement commands
- Basic cell manipulation
- Hands-on exercise: Creating your first SC-IM spreadsheet

### Part 2: Data Entry and Formatting (15 minutes)

**Working with Data**
- Entering and editing cell data
- Number formats and text alignment
- Cell formatting options
- Working with columns and rows
- Copying and moving data
- Hands-on exercise: Formatting a data table

### Part 3: Formulas and Functions (15 minutes)

**Calculations and Analysis**
- Basic formula syntax
- Built-in functions overview
- Cell references and ranges
- Mathematical operations
- Text manipulation functions
- Hands-on exercise: Creating formulas for data analysis

### Part 4: Advanced Features and Integration (15 minutes)

**Power User Techniques**
- Importing and exporting data
- CSV and Excel compatibility
- Keyboard shortcuts for efficiency
- Integrating with command line tools
- Automation possibilities
- Hands-on exercise: Creating a data workflow with SC-IM

## Learning Outcomes

By completing this microlearning session, you will be able to:

- Navigate and edit data in the SC-IM interface
- Format cells, rows, and columns efficiently
- Create and use formulas for calculations
- Import data from CSV and other formats
- Export results for use in other applications
- Understand the advantages of terminal-based spreadsheets
- Incorporate SC-IM into command-line workflows

## Who Should Attend

This microlearning session is ideal for:

- Command line enthusiasts seeking spreadsheet functionality
- Data analysts who work frequently in terminal environments
- System administrators who need quick data manipulation tools
- Developers looking to incorporate spreadsheet functionality in scripts
- Anyone interested in lightweight alternatives to Excel/LibreOffice

Basic familiarity with the command line is recommended but not required.

## Materials and Resources

Participants will receive:

- SC-IM command reference guide
- Sample spreadsheets for practice
- Data sets for analysis exercises
- Integration examples with other tools
- Shortcut cheat sheet for rapid operation
- 30 days of email support for SC-IM questions
